verses.text: Now there was a man from Benjamin whose name was Kish, son of Abiel, son of Zeror, son of Becorath, son of Aphiah, a Benjamite, a man of wealth.
verses.comment: Closely follows the genealogical listing.

verses.text: He had a son named Saul, a handsome young man. There was not a man among the sons of Israel more handsome than he. From his shoulders upward, he was taller than any of the people.
verses.comment: Preserves physical description; 'heads taller' rendered for clarity.

verses.text: Now the donkeys of Kish, Saul's father, were lost. So Kish said to Saul his son, 'Take one of the servants with you, and go look for the donkeys.'
verses.comment: Maintains narrative setup.

verses.text: He passed through the hill country of Ephraim, and through the land of Shalishah, but they did not find them. Then they passed through the land of Shaalim, but they were not there. Then they passed through the territory of Benjamin, but did not find them.
verses.comment: Retains geographical markers.

verses.text: When they came to the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant who was with him, 'Come, let us return. Otherwise my father might stop thinking about the donkeys and become anxious for us.'
verses.comment: Explains Saul's concern naturally.

verses.text: But he said to him, 'Look, there is a man of God in this city, and he is an honored man. All that he says surely comes true. Let us go there; perhaps he can tell us the way we should go.'
verses.comment: 'Man of God' used; maintains high status and prophetic reputation.

verses.text: Then Saul said to his servant, 'But if we go, what shall we bring the man? For the bread in our bags is gone, and there is no gift to bring to the man of God. What do we have?'
verses.comment: Gift-giving custom is clear.

verses.text: The servant answered Saul, 'Here, I have a quarter shekel of silver. I will give it to the man of God so that he may tell us our way.'
verses.comment: Coin amount modernized as 'quarter shekel.'

verses.text: (Formerly in Israel, when a man went to inquire of God, he would say, 'Come, let us go to the seer'; for today’s 'prophet' used to be called a 'seer.')
verses.comment: Historical note on terminology made clear.

verses.text: Saul said to his servant, 'Well said; come, let us go.' So they went to the city where the man of God was.
verses.comment: Renders Saul's agreement and action plainly.

verses.text: As they went up the hill to the city, they met young women coming out to draw water and asked them, 'Is the seer here?'
verses.comment: Retains narrative sequence and cultural context.

verses.text: They answered, 'Yes, he is here. See, he is just ahead of you. Hurry now, for he has come to the city today because the people have a sacrifice on the high place.
verses.comment: Phrase 'high place' kept as used in original.

verses.text: As soon as you enter the city, you will find him before he goes up to the high place to eat. The people will not eat until he comes, because he must bless the sacrifice. Afterward, those invited will eat. Now go up; for you will find him right now.'
verses.comment: Blessing of sacrifice and customary waiting explained.

verses.text: So they went up to the city. As they were entering the city, Samuel came out toward them on his way up to the high place.
verses.comment: Visual narrative remains.

verses.text: Now the day before Saul came, the LORD had revealed to Samuel,
verses.comment: 'Revealed' as in original Hebrew 'uncovered the ear.'

verses.text: 'Tomorrow about this time I will send you a man from the land of Benjamin, and you shall anoint him to be leader over my people Israel. He will save my people from the hand of the Philistines; for I have looked on my people, because their cry has come to me.'
verses.comment: Hebrew 'prince' rendered as 'leader'; theological meaning preserved.

verses.text: When Samuel saw Saul, the LORD told him, 'Here is the man of whom I spoke to you! He will rule over my people.'
verses.comment: Divine identification direct and clear.

verses.text: Then Saul approached Samuel at the gate and said, 'Please tell me where the seer’s house is.'
verses.comment: Dialogue rendered simply.

verses.text: Samuel answered Saul, 'I am the seer. Go up before me to the high place, for you will eat with me today. In the morning, I will let you go and will tell you all that is in your heart.'
verses.comment: Samuel's hospitality and prophetic insight preserved.

verses.text: As for your donkeys that were lost three days ago, do not be concerned about them; they have been found. For whom is all that is desirable in Israel? Is it not for you and for all your father's house?'
verses.comment: 'Desirable' highlights Saul's coming elevation.

verses.text: Saul answered, 'Am I not a Benjamite, from the smallest of the tribes of Israel? And is my family the least of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin? Why then have you spoken to me in this way?'
verses.comment: Saul's humility rendered as per original intent.

verses.text: Then Samuel took Saul and his servant and brought them into the hall and gave them a place at the head of the guests, about thirty persons.
verses.comment: 'Head of the guests' made explicit.

verses.text: Samuel said to the cook, 'Bring the portion I gave you, the one I told you to put aside.'
verses.comment: Instruction to cook kept literal.

verses.text: So the cook took up the thigh and what was on it, and set it before Saul. Then Samuel said, 'See, what was kept is set before you. Eat, because it was kept for you for this appointed time, since I said, "I have invited the people."' So Saul ate with Samuel that day.
verses.comment: 'Thigh' (or 'leg') used as per Hebrew; special portion noted.

verses.text: When they came down from the high place into the city, Samuel spoke with Saul on the roof.
verses.comment: Rooftop conference preserved as in original, implying privacy.

verses.text: They rose early, and at daybreak Samuel called to Saul on the roof, 'Get up, so I can send you on your way.' So Saul arose, and both he and Samuel went out into the street.
verses.comment: Sequence made clear: early rising and travel.

verses.text: As they were going down to the edge of the city, Samuel said to Saul, 'Tell the servant to go on ahead of us—and he went on—but you stay here a while, so I may reveal to you the word of God.'
verses.comment: Samuel's intention to deliver God's message to Saul noted.
